name: Transistor & Semiconductor Devices
description: Sub-sector template for semiconductor device patents (CPC H01L29*) including transistors, FETs, and diodes.
contextDescription: Transistor and device patents cover fundamental semiconductor building blocks. Key areas include FinFETs, gate-all-around (GAA), MOSFET improvements, power devices (IGBT, SiC, GaN), and memory transistors. High-value targets include Intel, Samsung, TSMC (foundry), and all chipmakers. These are often foundational patents with broad implications.
scoringGuidance: FinFET and GAA patents are essential for advanced nodes (7nm and below).
Power device patents (SiC, GaN) target EV and data center power.
Low-leakage transistor designs are critical for mobile.
High-frequency transistor patents target RF and 5G.
Memory transistors (floating gate, charge trap) are in all flash storage.

questions.question: What transistor type does this patent cover? Score: 1-3 for legacy planar, 4-6 for specialty (RF, power), 7-10 for advanced (FinFET, GAA, nanosheet).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the transistor architecture and its technology node relevance.

questions.question: What process nodes is this relevant to? Score higher for advanced nodes (10nm and below).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess process node applicability. Advanced nodes are higher value.

questions.question: Is this a power semiconductor (IGBT, SiC, GaN)? Power devices target EV, data centers, and industrial.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Power semiconductors are a high-growth market (EV, renewable).

questions.question: How relevant is this to foundries (TSMC, Samsung, Intel)? Foundry-applicable patents have broad licensing potential.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Patents that apply to foundry processes can be licensed broadly.
